title: Serbian Army Put on Highest Alert Over Kosovo Tensions
description: Serbia’s President Aleksandar Vucic has ordered the nation’s army on full alert after weeks of rising tensions in neighboring Kosovo where the local Serb minority has been confronting the authorities over new registration requirements, putting up road blockades and holding protests that threaten to tip into violence, the defense ministry says.

title: Iran Compels Jet to Land, Removes Family of Football Icon Ali Daei
description: Iranian authorities ordered a Dubai-bound flight to land on Monday, barring family members of an outspoken Iranian football icon from leaving the country and accusing them of taking part in anti-government protests.

title: Turkey Announces Massive Boost to Black Sea Natural-Gas Reserves Estimate
description: ZONGULDAK, TURKEY - JULY 29: Fatih and Kanuni drilling ships are seen as Kanuni drilling vessel completed the flow test of Turkali-2 well at Sakarya Gas Field, in Zonguldak, Turkey on July 29, 2021. (Photo by Celal Gunes/Anadolu Agency via Getty Images)

title: China to End Quarantines for Inbound Travelers as ‘Covid Zero’ Dismantled
China to End Covid-Quarantine Measures From Jan. 8 Despite Surging Cases
description: China will scrap all quarantine measures for Covid-19 from Jan. 8, including requirements for inbound visitors, according to the National Health Commission, Bloomberg News reports.The country will also downgrade Covid-control measures to the ‘Category-B’ level.

title: More Rohingya Refugees Reach Indonesia After Weeks at Sea
description: Pidie, Indonesia (AP) -- A second group in two days of weak and exhausted Rohingya Muslims landed on a beach in Indonesia’s northernmost province of Aceh on Monday after weeks at sea, officials said.

title: Argentina’s Fernandez Now Says He’ll Comply With Top Court Order
description: Argentina’s national government will comply with a Supreme Court order that called for it to return federal funds to the government of the city of Buenos Aires even as the president continues disputing the case.

title: Western New York Reports 27 Storm-related Deaths; US Death Toll Rises to At Least 48
description: Buffalo, N.Y. (AP) -- 27 storm-related deaths reported in western New York as nation’s death toll from storm rises to at least 48.

title: Ninety People Cross English Channel in Two Boats on Christmas Day
description: Ninety people crossed the English Channel in two small boats on Christmas Day.

title: China’s Xi Urges Better Hygiene as Nation Continues Covid Shift
description: China should guide the public to develop health knowledge and good personal hygiene habits as President Xi Jinping fleshes out the country’s move away from strict Covid Zero.

title: Egypt Banks to Help Clear Import Backlog Within Days, Sisi Says
description: Egypt’s banks will help secure the necessary dollars to clear a backlog of imports within four days, President Abdel-Fattah El-Sisi said Monday.

title: Three Die in New Drone Attack on Russian Strategic Bomber Base
description: Three servicemen were killed during a Ukrainian drone attack at a military air base in southern Russia that hosts strategic bombers, the Defense Ministry in Moscow said Monday.

title: South Korea Deploys Jets After North Sends Drones Across Border
description: South Korea suspended some commercial flights and scrambled military assets to shoot at drones from North Korea that crossed their heavily armed border Monday.

title: India’s Finance Minister Sitharaman Hospitalized, PTI Says
description: India’s Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman was admitted to the All India Institute of Medical Sciences in New Delhi on Monday, Press Trust of India reported, citing unnamed people.

title: Ukraine Latest: Three Dead in Drone Attack on Russian Air Base
description: Three Russian soldiers died after a drone attack on a military air base in the south of the country, the state-run Tass news service reported, citing the Defense Ministry.

title: Japan’s Kishida Set to Replace Fourth Minister in Two Months
description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida plans to replace the fourth minister since October from his cabinet, in an effort to reverse falling approval rates as his government seeks to push a record budget through parliament.

title: S. Korea Fires Warning Shots After North Drones Cross Border
description: Seoul, South Korea (AP) -- South Korea's military fired warning shots and scrambled aircraft after North Korean drones entered the South’s airspace on Monday, South Korean officials said, days after the North launched two ballistic missiles in its latest testing activities.

title: Pakistan Troops Search for Attackers After 6 Soldiers Killed
description: Quetta, Pakistan (AP) -- Pakistani forces on Monday expanded their search for the perpetrators behind multiple attacks that killed six troops and wounded 17 civilians in a restive southwestern province the previous day.

title: From House Prices to Oat Milk Recycling, Here Are Our Predictions for 2023
description: The Ukraine crisis, the British economy and global climate talks will face turning points next year, say our experts.

title: Western NY Death Toll Rises to 27 From Cold, Storm Chaos
description: Buffalo, N.Y. (AP) -- The death toll from a pre-Christmas blizzard that paralyzed the Buffalo area and much of the country has risen to 27 in western New York authorities said Monday as the region dug out from one of the worst weather-related disasters in its history.

title: China Holds Biggest Military Drill Near Taiwan Since Pelosi Trip
description: China sent 71 warplanes as a part of its biggest display of military might near Taiwan since US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited the democratically-run island in August, with Taipei accusing Beijing of “military intimidation.”

title: Brazil to Boost Security for Lula Inauguration After Bomb Threat
description: Brazil will reevaluate the procedures for President elect Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s inauguration after an explosive near capital Brasilia’s international airport was disarmed Saturday, the country’s incoming justice minister said.
